poem:
**The Many Faces of Harriet**

In the quiet 
lines between roles,  
a theater unspools—  
Ophelia's whisper  
becomes a monarch's decree.  
Dame of shifting scenes,   
tender and fierce,  
weaving tales  
with the turn of breath.   
Yet always,  
each part shedding  
to reveal, anew,  
just Harriet.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘You get more confident as the parts run out’: Harriet Walter on her stage career, Succession and Shakespeare’s women It has been simmering for years. Long before she was a dame, before she was withering in Succession, had appeared opposite Chewbacca in Star Wars, fat-shamed a baby in Ted Lasso and become one of the few – possibly the only – actor to play both a king and queen of England, Harriet Walter was Ophelia". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: ‘You get more confident as the parts run out’: Harriet Walter on her stage career, Succession and Shakespeare’s women It has been simmering for years.
